TT looks down at his ensignia.

TT:  I am no longer a Maximal.  My shame is to great.  This ensignia 
is only a symbol of what I was, and what I hope to be again someday.  
It is all I have for Iam now nothing.  But I suppose I could be a 
Maximal if it could get me off the planet.  Where are we again?

OOC: If Panthos knows this is Earth it'll be a big turn around.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jonathan" <jhogan@r...> wrote:
> He fires the plasma rifle 8 times in the general direction of 
Panthos 
> (general direction to compensat for where he thinks he'll probably 
> dodge to,l but close enough to pose a serious risk if he stands 
> still).
> 
> {Panthos}
> 
>     The panther almost smiled his movements agile as he dodged about 
half the shots, accepting the remaining four on his flank. His mocking 
chuckle as he took his seat once more shifting himself a bit to ignore 
the scorch marks on his beast forms rump.
> 
>     "Yes I imagine you do have quite a bit to atone for. Attacking 
first against an opponent who hasn't even drawn a weapon yet." His 
chuckle became louder, "Mayhaps you best shed this silly notion of 
atoning yourself for having to kill your kin. You're no more maximal 
than I am."
> 
>     "Now put away that weapon. In your current frame of mind you're 
lucky you could hit the broad side of cybertron. Now that I'm prepared 
for your tantrums you'll be just wasting energy attempting to hit me." 
His eyes locked on Turtails and gave an almost feline shrug. "Think 
about it. If I wanted to scrap you I'd have done it while you were in 
your self absorbed ranting."
> 
>     "Besides I know where a base belonging to your faction is 
located in these parts already. If you're sure you want to go ahead 
and kill your brother for making a choice, I'm sure they might provide 
you with assistance. And rather than scan for it yourself I can guide 
you. A deal you might say, information in exchange for spending my 
first day on this dirt ball without someone continually scorching my 
hide. Agreeable?"
> 
>     The panther waited watching the maximal cautiously ready to 
spring out of the way.
